snippet: Chief Judge Jonathan Lippman’s decision to let third-year law students sit for the bar exam in February in return for public service would create a new pool of lawyers for the indigent, experts said.
abstract: New York State's Chief Judge Jonathan Lippman clears the way for law students to take the bar exam early in return for devoting their last semester to pro bono works; legal experts say decision would create new pool of lawyers for the indigent, and has potential to change law education nationwide.
lead_paragraph: Chief Judge Jonathan Lippman’s decision to let third-year law students sit for the bar exam in February in return for public service would create a new pool of lawyers for the indigent, experts said.

headline.main: New York State’s Top Judge Permits Early Bar Exam in Exchange for Pro Bono Work
headline.print_headline: New York State’s Top Judge Permits Early Bar Exam in Exchange for Pro Bono Work
